comment: only 4 test
You don't need to go to the lectures, you can just read the textbook and be fine on the tests. You will be graded on only four exams, but they're easy especially if you do the practice exams.
I only attended the first class, and I still made a A+ in it. Very easy tests if you do the practice tests.

Very easy class! I only went to maybe 4 or 5 lectures and still got an A for the semester. He makes it clear that your grade is based off the average out of 4 tests. He gives practice test which are nearly the same as the real test and sends out reminders to take the tests just in case you forgot.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: The entire grade was based on four online open-internet access tests. He provides "practice tests" which are basically the test and you can easily use those and the textbook to study. No other study materials though. If you don't test well I wouldn't recommend. I never went to any lectures and got a 95 in this class. Take him if you can.
Easy class, you don't really need to show up, don't except anything from the professor though he does not answer emails at all (literally zero responses)

There are a total of 4 assignments which are all tests. No lockdown browser and the professor was super sweet and funny...although he was late to almost every lecture. He was pretty good at explaining and gave you the topics the test would be on for you to go back in the textbook and study.

He often shows up to class late and just rambles on about random things. Class is very easy but only has 4 grades and they are all tests. Exams have no lockdown browser and he gives a practice exam that is very similar to the real one.
Such an easy class you only have 4 exams (no lockdown browser) he does not take attendence either.
such an easy class attendance is not mandatory and the class only consists of 4 tests that are so easy and he doesn't use any lockdown browsers

Attendance is not mandatory. Your whole grade consists of 4 tests. He provides practice tests for these, with very similar questions. He only missed class once. The only way to fail is to not put in any effort and just not do the work. Overall this is an extremely easy class and he makes it toleratable and simple. Excellent teacher!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Grade is based on 4 exams, no final. I attended class only 3 times the entire semester. Classes were lecture heavy, and the professor rambles about random stuff often. However, one of the easiest classes. Just do the practice tests and self-teach using the textbook. Fail one test and you'll get a B like me so take those exams seriously.
Your grade is based on 4 tests. Therefore, it is very easy to fail or not get the grade you desire. Take the practice exams!!!! They are almost exactly the same as the questions on the tests.
Attendance isn't mandatory and he only has 4 exams the whole semester.

Good and easy class to take. His tests are all from the practice questions in the textbook. Attendance is not mandatory and most people stopped coming after the first test, but it was a good class! He was a few minutes late every single day though. One time he did not come and didn't post a cancellation. Would still take him again!
Easy A class trust. THERE'S NO WAY YOU WILL FAIL!! just do his practice exams
I did not show up to this class except the first day and got an A! Easy A take him!!! his practice exam is very very SIMILAR to his exam so take it!!! no lockdown and no webcam!
Graded by
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: do not go to class!! i wasted a lot of time going to class. he does not talk about the material much. there are 4 tests through 10 weeks. the practice tests are pretty much the same as the tests. super easy.

Does not show up to class on time. Usually late by 30+ minutes and sees no problem with it. Grade consist of 3 exams. Take the practice exam before the real exam it is the same Q&A as the real exam. I never showed up to class and finished with a 97%. Class is an easy A and only last 10 weeks. 
There are no curves or extra credit in this class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Very easy class. Use the practice tests, they are literally identical to the tests. Lectures were pointless so I never bothered going. Very easy to get an A on each tests, the 4 tests were averaged for a grade.

Lectures were pointless, never went over anything on the tests. 4 tests. He does give a practice test for each which is almost exact to the test, that's the only way I managed to do good on the tests. Use your resources and it's very easy to get an A on every test. No lockdown browser. Easy class just don't rely on the professor for much.

only 4 test grades and you can find answers pretty easy online. no need to come to class honestly, i went every lecture but i never paid attention and still got a high b. textbook isnt needed at all he just uses it to review sometimes but even then he shows it on the screen. hes pretty quiet so if you wanna pay attention sit close to the front

Very easy A, class only last until the end of October. 4 tests, practice test given for each that is almost identical to the test. No lockdown. He would show up 30 minutes late to every class, and gets off topic easy. I stopped coming to class after August and still passed with an A.

Super easy A and only 4 tests - gives a practice test before the test. Not the worst prof but not the best, but if you can't find anyone else he's not a bad option. Attendance is not required and honestly not very beneficial.
This course was from aug 15 - oct 19 which was nice! He was 15 mins late every class and ended early.

The whole class is just four exams to take. Most of the class he would talk through lectures and go off topic but if you pay attention you will understand. The tests are non lockdown browser and you can easily search up the questions on quizlet.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class
Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Light class. I took AP Micro in HS and this pretty much covers the same stuff expect for the third test. Half of the questions on the real test are the same as the practice test. Don't go to class if you don't want to. Don't sit in the back or you can barely hear him.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: This class was completely pointless. This professors lectures barely touched on the topics mentioned on the test- they were no help at all. The only thing that helped were the practice tests- but for that, just take an online class. The guy NEVER answers student emails and gave me incorrect confusing info on what chapters to study for what test.
All tests were open notes, classes were just lectures and slightly boring but he doesn't take attendance and all tests were online.

This class is overall 4 exams, this class is an easy A. If you do the practice exam I tell you it's very similar to the exam. Just study the practice exam and textbook but mainly the practice exam. I barely went to the lectures and passed all my exams. TAKE HIM!!! I promise you, you won't fail this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I absolutely loved this class! I took it online and it was so easy. If you study his lecture notes and take the practice quiz/study guide for each chapter, you'll make an easy A on every assignment and in the class. I learned a lot and the course was only 3 months long (Aug-Oct). Definitely recommend this professor!

Professor Metcalf is very understanding about everything. Lectures are not mandatory but could be useful. The course consists of 4 exams which aren't hard and those are the only grades. Very lenient and understanding, definitely recommend.

A waste of money and time. The teacher is nice but isn't covering anything to make students ready for his tests. In a large room, he doesn't use the microphone, every one in the back can not hear him. Study the book before the exams because the lectures only cover 20% of what is in them.
Professor Metcalf had good course content; however, it was difficult having to wait to see what you got wrong as you would have to manually request feedback. This is one thing I would change.

Class is absolutely not mandatory for this professor. DO THE PRACTICE EXAMS! The practice exams are almost identical to the tests and it'll help you a lot!!! I passed this class purely because of studying the practice test. Only 4 exams, no homework, no projects, so if you don't do good on tests, it isn't easy to pass but do the practice exam!!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: He rambles a lot to the point to where it's almost pointless to even go to class. Tests are super easy though.
This class was not hard at all, just make sure you know the material for the weekly quizzes and you're gucci. Economics is a boring class but this class was painless. Easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Don't buy the textbook. The prof provides so many resources for each module that I never used the book. Easy A if you read the material provided. Most test questions ask you to apply what you learned to specific scenarios, as well as definition questions. Would recommend!

He is by far one of the best and easiest professors I've had. He gives very clear instructions on what you have to do each week. He makes sure that you are prepared for the tests and exams by giving you study guides with answers and also gives you kahoot games to review with. You only have to do one weekly practice quiz, reg. quiz, and notes. Easy
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I took this class fully online. He posts everything you need on D2L. The study guides will help you tremendously with the quizzes. This class is pretty easy and doesn't last the full semester. So if you need to take ECON just take this class.

Very easy online class. Posts everything you need on D2L. Read through the handouts and take practice quizzes and it's an easy A. 10 week course where I put in 30mins of work per week and ended with a high A. He isn't really involved in the online setting, but he doesn't need to be. Very straightforward and easy to succeed online.
A few quizzes and like 3 or 4 exams. Easy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Metcalf gives plenty of material to succeed from lecture notes, study guides, powerpoints, and various videos to watch for each Unit. Take notes and use the material he gives you and you'll pass the quizzes and exams which can be tricky

I took this class online, it was very easy. The notes he provided was straight forward. The quizzes and practice were great practice for the actual exam. They also gave feedback to which answers you got wrong so you can correct them on the exam.

Metcalf was an amazing Econ professor. He provides lecture notes, videos, and study guides for each chapter. He also has practice quizzes and practice exams before the graded ones so you can see what you need to go back and study.

He is a horrible professor and I am an all A student. This is the first time I have ever had to drop a class in college. He only has 3 tests and no final so there is literally no room to not do well on a test. If you have the option of taking another teacher do that.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Don't know how I got an A. Pretty okay professor. Kind of got off topic in class but attendance is not needed. Most of the class only showed up on test days and still got As. I struggled a little because econ is not my strong suit but somehow got an A. Read the textbook and do the practice questions and you'll be okay.

Professor Metcalf is a really nice guy! Most of the test questions come from the back of the book. Whole course consists of only 3 tests. There's no extra credit, but if you study the practice questions you will do well on the tests. If you're not one to attend class regularly, I recommend him. A lot of people did well with minimal attendance.

3 tests, thats it. Never went to class and got an 87. Don't count on him to give good lectures, he goes off on tangents and goes so off topic. Youll have to teach yourself all of it but its not a hard class.

You are graded by 3 test. That is it. 10 week course, no mandatory attendance but it helps! He is funny and class doesn't last the whole time. Many of his test questions come from the back of the book, so BUY the book. I never studied and rarely went to class and made an A!

He wasn't really a bad professor (for the times i went to class) but he's just older so it's harder to hear and take notes. He's not good at answering emails at all but again he's old. Only assignments were 3 tests and they're mostly the exact questions from the textbook
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Metcalf is a nice man but the class is definitely not an easy A. There is no extra credit and only 3 exams. The first exam is fairly easy but for the next two it is necessary to study. Attendance isn't mandatory and if you come to class the book is not necessary. But the book does have practice questions used on exams. LECTURE HEAVY!

Can I just say, I have never made a B before in my life and I am barely scrapping by with one in this class. I've taken Econ before and this class was so confusing and inconsistent. The tests had nothing to do with what he taught and even when I spent hours studying the book I made lower grades than before. I would highly recommend not taking him.

He was a good teacher but his lectures are extremely boring. There were only 3 tests including the final and class ended halfway through the semester which was nice. Make sure you study, especially the chapter questions because they're pretty much the test. Take notes when he writes stuff down but make sure you have the textbook. There was no hmwk.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Metcalf is such a nice and funny man! His class is just way too difficult compared to other Econ classes. Granted I am not an Econ-minded person, I struggled on his tests. He does not reply to emails and your grade is only 3 tests. Some questions on the tests come from the back of the book!

It's almost as if they don't make professors like this anymore, which is real shame. Take his class if you desire a simple, old-school class format. Only grades are 3 tests, and are based solely on his lectures, which are fun to listen to. I went to class sometimes just to hear his jokes and childhood stories.

Entire class was graded based on 3 exams, and before each exam he sends you a study guide telling you exactly what will be on the test. I never showed up, never read the textbook, and only studied once for each exam for about an hour, and I got an A. Easiest Econ professor by far and a very nice man overall. Would recommend!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: His class is annoying cause half of it is him just talking about nothing and half is the actual important info. I say dont skip cause hell tell you what chapters to read what parts are important and what arent. I did okay in the class but I would recommend the better Thomas. Thomas Garr.

The class only consist of 3 test. The test questions are straight out of the textbook he will have you get. His lectures are pretty boring, but honestly you can skip every class and still do good on the test. That is if you review the questions that are in the book. He also provides a study guide before the test, so that's a plus.

Showed up for four classes-the first day and the three exams and squeaked out a B. Other classmates said his notes came directly from the book, so it was pointless to go. Three exams make up your ENTIRE GRADE. Half the questions on exams come directly from the end of chapter questions. Just read the textbook and know how to apply terms to graphs.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Not that difficult of a class, attendance is not mandatory and as long as you read the book and do the review questions, you should be fine. 3 exams make up your grade, so that can be stressful. Lots of people never went to class and still did fine on the exams.

Showed up for maybe 5 classes and got a B. Pointless to show up. His tests are easy because most of the question on the test are from the practice questions in the textbook EXACTLY COPIED. His lectures are boring and doesn't care at all if you show up. Be careful only 3 tests. No homework at all and wasn't offered any extra credit.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He is an okay professor, but nothing special. He does not check attendance and his lectures almost word-for-word go along with the textbook, so only half the class showed up after the first week. His tests are manageable because the questions are mostly copied over from the textbook. The class was kinda boring, so I don't recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Not the best professor, but definitely not the worst. If the majority of the class fail a test he gives an extra credit assignment. Only 3 tests that arent terrible if you look through the textbook. Overall, not a bad choice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Love the teacher, but I hate the class. Personally, economics is a difficult course as it's super heavy in material. However, Professor Metcalf is super caring. He gave an extra assignment because we all bombed the last test so that was great. He wants us to pass. Reading is necessary for survival.

His class is based off 3 exams. Before the exams he will post an overview of what to study, if you find that stuff in the book and look over the chapter questions in the book, you will be fine for the test. I never went to class. Lol

His class is graded by 3 exams and sometimes an extra credit assignment if you show up. He is funny and his lectures were not that bad. I took his class from 8 pm to 9 and was expecting to fall asleep but he keeps you interested. He gives answers during the lecture so pay attention.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Very easy class, three tests that if you look over the material you will have no problem getting an A. Attendance is not taken, there were many people who only came on test days for the whole semester and got a B or an A. His lectures can be VERY boring though, they seem like they are gonna drag on forever.
